events.title: RSF drone attack kills 24 people fleeing fighting in central Sudan, says doctors group
events.description: Eight children including two infants among dead in vehicle carrying displaced people, says Sudan Doctors Network A drone attack by a paramilitary group has hit a vehicle carrying displaced families in central Sudan, killing at least 24 people, including eight children, a doctors‚Äô group said on Saturday. The attack by the Rapid Support Forces took place close to the city of Er Rahad in North Kordofan province, according to the Sudan Doctors Network, which tracks the country‚Äôs war. The vehicle was transporting displaced people who fled fighting in the Dubeiker area, the group said in a statement. Among the dead children were two infants. Continue reading...

events.title: Weather tracker: Spain and Portugal hit by third deadly storm in two weeks
events.description: Storm Marta sweeps Iberian peninsula just days after Storms Kristin and Leonardo brought deadly flooding and major damage Spain and Portugal have endured another storm over the weekend, just days after the deadly flooding and major damage caused by Storm Kristin and Storm Leonardo last week. Storm Marta passed over the Iberian peninsula on Saturday, bringing fresh torrential rain and killing two people. Storm Kristin killed at least five people after it made landfall on 28 January with Storm Leonardo claiming another victim last Wednesday . The outlook for this week is for more rain across Spain, Portugal and France, especially across north-west Portugal, where more than 100mm is possible during the first half of the week. Some of the heaviest of the rain will transfer to southern Italy and western parts of Greece and Turkey later in the week. Continue reading...

events.title: Ecuadorian leaves, Argentine protests and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.description: Feb. 6-12, 2026 Ramon Pucha demonstrated how to turn a leaf into a hat to protect himself from the sun while looking for seeds to grow on his family‚Äôs farm, where he preserves native species and shares seedlings with neighboring communities in an effort to protect biodiversity, in Ecuador‚Äôs Amazon region. Students led a march on National Youth Day in Caracas, Venezuela, to call for the release of detainees who are considered political prisoners by their relatives and human rights groups. Workers mobilized by trade unions converged in a Buenos Aires square, blocking traffic and clashing with police as Argentina‚Äôs Senate debated and ultimately approved a labor overhaul. This gallery was curated by photographer Esteban Felix, based in Santiago, Chile. ___ AP photography: https://apnews.com/photography Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/apnews

events.description: Rahman returned to Bangladesh in December after more than 17 years of self-exile in London. Going into the vote, Rahman was confident he could secure enough votes to govern alone.

events.description: A proposal by anti-immigration Swiss People's Party has gained enough signatures to head to a referendum this June. But lawmakers and business groups argue the move could cause economic chaos.

events.title: Pakistan: Imran Khan to be examined over vision loss claims
events.description: The Supreme Court order to examine Khan comes after his attorney told media that the former prime minister had lost most of his vision in his right eye. Khan has been in prison since 2023 due to a graft case conviction.

events.title: Russia blocks YouTube and WhatsApp
events.description: More websites and messenger apps are becoming inaccessible in Russia. While users look for ways around government bans, others wonder what will ultimately remain of the internet.

events.title: Kim Jong Un's daughter set to be his successor, Seoul says
events.description: Kim Ju Ae, the daughter of North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un, is estimated to be around 13 years old. She has already appeared by her father's side at military events.

events.title: 2026 Olympics: France's Miradoli takes Super-G silver
events.description: Romane Miradoli won silver in the Super-G at the Milan-Cortina 2026 Olympic Games. At 31, the French skier claimed her first Olympic medal ‚Äì the first for a French woman in Alpine skiing in 24 years. She was beaten by Italy's Federica Brignone, who triumphed just 10 months after suffering a serious left leg injury.

events.title: Venezuela postpones vote on amnesty bill to protect political dissidents
events.description: Venezuelan lawmakers on Thursday postponed a landmark amnesty bill meant to halt the use of courts against dissenters after failing to agree on its implementation. Thousands rallied in Caracas demanding the release of political prisoners. The bill would clear charges against opponents of former leaders Nicolas Maduro and Hugo Chavez.
events.ticker_label: üí• Venezuela postpones vote on amnesty bill to protect political dissidents

events.title: Japan seizes Chinese fishing boat and arrests captain
events.description: Japan seized a Chinese fishing boat Thursday and arrested its captain, authorities said Friday, alleging that the boat was sailing inside Japan's exclusive economic zone. Beijing has called on Tokyo to respect the rights of the vessel's Chinese crew members.

events.title: EU leaders back major economic overhaul to counter pressure from US, China and Russia
events.description: European Union leaders on Thursday agreed on an action plan to overhaul the bloc‚Äôs economy and boost competitiveness amid pressure from US President Donald Trump, China and Russia. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said the March plan would upgrade energy grids, deepen financial integration and ease merger rules.

events.title: French police arrest two Louvre museum employees over ‚Äòlarge-scale‚Äô ticket fraud
events.description: French police have arrested nine people, including two employees working at the Louvre museum in Paris, suspected of involvement in a ‚Äúlarge-scale‚Äù ticket fraud ring, a source familiar with the case said Thursday. The fraud scheme was allegedly launched in the summer of 2024 and is thought to have mainly targeted Chinese tourists.

events.title: Epstein's victims feared he secretly filmed them - emails suggest they were right
events.description: Sky News has found an email exchange from 2014 showing that convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein asked a member of staff to install hidden video cameras at his home in Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Kim Jong Un set to name daughter as next leader of North Korea, spy agency says
events.description: A teenage girl will become the next leader of North Korea, with Kim Jong Un set to confirm his daughter as successor, spy chiefs believe.

events.title: Trump's major breakaway from climate science
events.description: üëâ Follow Trump100 on your podcast app üëà

events.title: Mosque gunman wanted online fame. A New Zealand has tried to curb that
events.description: New Zealand's Court of Appeal has finished hearing an appeal from the Christchurch mosque gunman, in proceedings that were quiet and tightly controlled
events.ticker_label: üí• Mosque gunman wanted online fame. A New Zealand has tried to curb that

events.title: During the Winter Games, some Milan churches are teaching Olympic values to thousands of kids
events.description: A Milan church uses the buzz around the 2026 Winter Olympics to teach kids that sports values matter in everyday life

events.title: Judge orders jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora returned to house arrest
events.description: A judge has ordered that Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora be returned to house arrest again while awaiting trial after spending nearly a year in jail in his latest stint of incarceration

events.title: A judge has ordered the release of jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora
events.description: A judge has ordered the release of jailed Guatemalan journalist Jos√© Rub√©n Zamora

events.title: Nursery worker in London sentenced to 18 years for abusing young children in his care
events.description: A 45-year-old man has been sentenced to 18 years in prison for sexually abusing young children, some as young as two, who were under his care in London

events.title: Barbados' prime minister clinches a third term in office after a clean sweep at the polls
events.description: The prime minister of Barbados has clinched a third consecutive term in office after securing all 30 seats of Parliament

events.title: Louis Vuitton‚Äôs Dutch arm to pay 500,000 euros to settle a money laundering case
events.description: Louis Vuitton‚Äôs Dutch business has agreed to pay 500,000 euros in an out-of-court settlement after prosecutors linked the fashion house and luxury goods maker to a money laundering case

events.title: Women and girls in science: Dismantling barriers, closing gender gaps
events.description: Although women are more likely than young men to pursue higher education, they make up only 35 per cent of science graduates.

events.title: In Bahrain; work, dignity and the quiet rise of home-grown enterprise
events.description: From a crochet hook in a Cairo living room to digital marketplaces reaching across borders, women entrepreneurs are demonstrating how creativity, persistence and targeted support can translate into livelihoods ‚Äî even when formal employment is out of reach.

events.title: Former FBI agent calls holster setup in Nancy Guthrie case 'incredibly amateur and unsafe'
events.description: Former FBI agents question an "amateur and unsafe" holster setup in Nancy Guthrie case surveillance video, calling the configuration dangerous.

events.title: K-9 hit by vehicle during bank robbery chase keeps going and helps capture suspect
events.description: A Georgia K-9 Robbi was struck by a car during a bank robbery chase but kept pursuing the suspect until capture. The brave dog is expected to recover.

events.title: Police request neighbor surveillance footage from narrow time frames before Nancy Guthrie vanished
events.description: Police investigating Nancy Guthrie's disappearance focus on specific January dates, seeking surveillance footage as the 84-year-old's case unfolds.

events.title: Advanced video equipment seen at Nancy Guthrie home as experts break down its possible role
events.description: Forensic tent removed from Nancy Guthrie's home as investigators bring high-tech video equipment inside for ongoing analysis of evidence in the case.

events.title: European nation votes to cap population at 10M in major immigration crackdown referendum
events.description: Switzerland will vote June 14 on capping population at 10 million as anti-immigration referendum gains momentum with population nearing 9.1 million.

events.title: Uproar after Iran named vice-chair of UN body promoting democracy, women‚Äôs rights
events.description: Iran's appointment as vice-chair of UN Commission for Social Development faces sharp criticism from human rights advocates and Iranian activists calling it a 'mockery'.

events.title: US forces complete withdrawal from strategic al-Tanf Garrison in Syria
events.description: The U.S. military has completed its withdrawal from al-Tanf Garrison in southern Syria, handing over control to government forces.

events.title: Iranian brutality: Nobel laureate fighting for life after barbaric assault at notorious prison
events.description: The Nobel Committee is demanding Iran stop alleged brutal abuse of peace laureate Narges Mohammadi, who has been imprisoned since December after attending a funeral.

events.title: Trump meets Netanyahu, says he wants Iran deal but reminds Tehran of ‚ÄòMidnight Hammer‚Äô operation
events.description: President Donald Trump and Israeli prime minister signal uncertainty on Iran diplomacy after White House talks, with Trump pushing negotiations while keeping other options open.

events.title: Trump, Netanyahu to meet at White House in high-stakes talks on Iran, Gaza plan
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu meets President Donald Trump Wednesday to discuss Iran negotiations, as Washington weighs diplomacy against military action.

events.title: Nicaragua blocks pathway used by Cuban migrants to reach the US
events.description: Nicaragua blocks Cuban citizens from entering without visas, eliminating a key migration route to the U.S. border through Central America and Mexico.

events.title: UK public health system posts job ad for nurse focused on 'close-relative marriage'
events.description: UK health agency advertises nursing role for families in cousin marriages linked to higher genetic risks for children in controversial health program.
